urls.title: Experts share tips for tackling plastic pollution in Portsmouth
urls.description: Online workshop encourages local people to stamp out avoidable plastic waste.

tweets.text:
We ran a workshop with @portsmouthuni for local groups looking at ideas on behaviour change on disposing of plastics.

Experts believe around 10 mill tonnes of plastic waste enters the ocean each year, which is equivalent to a bin lorry load every minute. https://t.co/Ge1UbZYHsX https://t.co/spDtstZVTH

tweets.text:
Having been in this meeting, it‚Äôs clear we need a path forward.

It‚Äôs time for @BarnetCouncil and @EnvAgency to step up and meet the challenges the Welsh Harp faces.

The volunteers are wonderful and working hard, but statutory bodies need to play their part too. https://t.co/gJG0cDds5m

@BarnetCouncil @Thames21 @welshharpies @silkstreamers @Feargal_Sharkey @NaturalEngland @TonyJuniper Meanwhile illegal fishing contributes to death of protected birds, shorelines of rare fenland and wetland plants are destroyed, riverbanks are strewn with mattresses and plastic, dredging is a pipe dream and there is little traction with @EnvAgency.
